---641449471-1447956925-1359621895=:35652
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello Noah!

Thanks for your reply!

Yes, I use Wayback Machine Beta for re=
playing it.

Like you said, I did a check for broken links this morning (us=
ing Xenu link sleuth) and now I'm really confused. Due to the tests I did I=
 got several archived versions of the said website. In some cases Xenu says=
 everything is alright, in other cases he reports an issue concerning a fil=
e named index.jsp because of server error (500) or (in other cases) page no=
t found (404).

I tried to find the jsp file to take a look at it, but it w=
on't show up anywhere. Neither in the live web version nor in my archived v=
ersion... But Xenu finds an empty url almost every time .


Steph





____=
____________________________
 Von: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>
An: ar=
chive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
CC: Steph <sherlock.h221b@...> 
Gesend=
et: 23:41 Mittwoch, 30.Januar 2013
Betreff: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem w=
ith CSS
 
Hello Steph,

Are you replaying your crawled content using waybac=
k?

You need to zero in on the issue. Browsers these days have a way to vie=
w all the requests and responses as they go by (web console/net in firefox,=
 developer tools/network in chrome, etc.) Open your url in wayback and look=
 for 404s or other anomalies. When you see something is missing then you ca=
n try to figure out why. If you don't see anything missing at least you've =
narrowed it down and can continue investigating elsewhere.

Noah


On 2013-=
01-30 02:14 , Steph wrote:
>
>
> Hi everyone!
>
> I'm new to this group and=
 new to web archiving.
>
> I'm studying Media Preservation and for a projec=
t I try to save a few websites using Heritrix. It generally works really fi=
ne.
>
> But some websites really give me a headache, because the layout won=
't work. The images are all there, the Css files are also saved, but it won=
't show the defined frames! The content is just lined up, one below the oth=
er, instead of beneath or above each other.
>
> I already raised the number=
 of MaxTransHops and SpeculativeHops and it worked for a number of websites=
, but not for this.
>
> One of the websites is http://www.landesarchiv-bw.d=
e.
>
> Maybe you can give me some advice?
> It would be very appreciated!
>=

> Thanks in advance,
>
> Steph
>
>
>
>
